page.title: 19FARMING AND AGRICULTURE
page.content: MOST OF THE FARMLAND IS CONCENTRATED IN THE TOP THIRD AND FORMS THE EDGE OF A MUCH DENSER DISTRIBUTION OF FARMS BEYOND. DIVIDING THE FARMS ARE SCATTERED WOODLANDS OF MOSTLY CONIFEROUS TREES,COVERING ABOUT ONE SIXTH OF THE TOTAL BLOCK.THERE ARE NO FEWER THAN EIGHT FARMS. ONE IS WELL - KNOWN FOR IT'S TROUT;ANOTHER OPENLY ADVERTISES IT'S MARKET GARDEN PRODUCE TO PASSERS-BY. ONE CAN PURCHASE ANYTHING FROM POULTRY TO TOMATOES,AND MOST OF THE MARKET GARDEN FARMS CAN SELL THEIR GOODS ON SITE. SINCE THE TREND TO BUY MORE HOME GROWN FOOD DEVELOPED,LOCAL DEMAND IS SUFFICIENT TO PREVENT THE FARMER FROM SENDING THE PRODUCE TO MARKET. ONE DISTINCT FARM IS RENOWNED FOR ITS HORSE SLAUGHTERING THE END PRODUCT IS DOG FOOD.
